website_summaries.verdict: Popular dog chews with chewy texture and distinct X-shape design, available in original chicken flavor, beef, bacon, and fresh.
pros: Dogs love these treats, which have "triple action" effectiveness that cleans teeth, freshens breath, and is clinically shown to reduce plaque/tartar buildup
Sizes for all dog breeds, and 4 different flavors
cons: Some dogs eat these chews so quickly there is no chance for the chewing action required to clean teeth

customer_reviews.title: keeps their breath smelling nice!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these as a treat and keeping their oral health. We buy these regularly with Kong Large as a care package for displaced dogs. My neighbor fosters a lot of dogs, and every month we get her a nice cushion leash, Dentastix and Kong. Most of the dogs we send this care package to has had their teeth neglected. So it is quite important that they get this dentastix. We did a lot of research and decided on this set of products because they all work very well. Dentastix, Kong and a nice leash for the new owner.
customer_reviews.author: Kung pow wow

customer_reviews.title: One a Day, Every Day for Three Years - White, Clean Teeth.
customer_reviews.text: The "I" who loves Pedigree Dentastix is a 62 lb. Lab who smiles when she's in trouble. Undoubtedly she uses this to keep her teeth nice and white. Greater impact when she ducks her head, tips it sideways and gives you what looks like a Photoshopped smile... She's right, it works...she never has to sit in the corner! Her teeth really are white and clean all the way to the gum, with just 1 treat daily, at bedtime, then a drink she's ready for bed. (She also gets a large knuckle bone a couple times each month.)
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Dogs Teeth Clean and Fresh
customer_reviews.text: Our dog Maya enjoys a half piece daily after her first trip outside. She is a Cairn Terrier mix and is under 20 pounds, so the recommended amount is 1/2 a piece. We have had her for 3 years, since we rescued her as a 1 year old. She loves her morning treat and usually chews it all immediately. She has very little tartar on her teeth for a 4 year old dog. I believe this is due to her daily treat of Pedigree Dentastix. She enjoys all three flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Campbell

customer_reviews.title: They really don't like them anyway and now a have a box full ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my labs and they both starting having diarrhea, shortly after eating one. I had tired the mint ones, before, which also lead to green diarrhea and these made them have yellow diarrhea. They really don't like them anyway and now a have a box full that I am afraid to give them. I just buy them the Old-Roy milk bones from Walmart and they love those. Plus, I buy tooth brushes and peanut butter, from the dollar store and every other day, I brush their teeth with peanut butter and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Stinky breath be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I love my dog but I didn't love her stinky breath. I bought these hoping I wouldn't have to turn away every time she licked or breathed in my face. I tried my best to take a picture of her actually eating one but by the time I finally caught up with her, she had crumbs left. I do want to mention that I didn't notice a difference the first time she ate one but have noticed a huge difference after a few. They come in bunches so you do have to separate them. She seems to love them and her breath doesn't stink anymore. Now I can have all the doggie kisses I want!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Good Snack for Our Doggos!
customer_reviews.text: We use these every night for our yellow lab and border collie. They caught onto the works "ready to go to bed" and "brush your teeth" so now every night, they get one of these toothbrushes to keep their teeth nice and clean. We don't give our dogs any wet food so I'm not sure if that's a bigger contribution to their good teeth, but I'm sure these help also. We will continue buying these in the future
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble this time  getting into the box
customer_reviews.text: My dog gets one of these every day. I had a real problem getting the outer box open this time...had to use a knife today..and trying to get it open, I hurt my arm somehow. I have pain in my elbow and can't get my arm all the way open. Hopefully by tomorrow it is ok. But if it is going to be this tough to get it open, you have lost me as a customer!!! This was awful today. And, what is wrong now with my arm. It wasn't strong enough today.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stale
customer_reviews.text: These treats go stale/hard very quickly. Within a week of opening the bag, these treats are rock hard, lost their smell, and my dog won't eat them anymore. And I was VERY careful to seal the bag completely every time. For smaller dogs who eat 1/2 a treat per day, they really should last longer. My dog only was able to eat 6 full treats before having to trash this bag. Also, I'm not sure how much these clean teeth since he inhales them within 1 minute. My 13lb dog bites chunks off, chews 1-2 times, then swallows. There's no way this is doing anything to clean his teeth. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: SharonT13

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Oral Health
customer_reviews.text: We've been giving our malamute Dentastix as part of her evening routine for about a decade now and she loves it, lines up for it, and knows it's bedtime after she's done chomping it down. Our vet has remarked several times how great her teeth and gums are. Since we don't brush her teeth (she bites the toothbrushes), we know this is doing it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: Two dogs/two breeds, neither will touch!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs, a Jack Russell, and a Bernese Mtn Dog, and neither one will touch them. The Bernese will devour just about anything, but not these. He anxiously takes it from my hand but then immediately drops it & walks away. The Jack won't even take it from my hand. (she usually loves big bones & treats) I don't understand all these raving reviews on here, unless there's just something wrong with this pack. They smell strange, maybe there's something wrong with this batch or something...? Not sure, but unfortunately was just a waste of $19
customer_reviews.author: JKing

customer_reviews.title: Joey Loves 'Em!
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving one of these to my 7-year-old Aussie at bedtime for most of his life and he really likes them. I didn't rate them on taste because I haven't tried them myself, but Joey seems to think they're great! His breath is very pleasant and the vet keeps telling me there is no tartar on his teeth, so I'm pleased. Amazon's price is much better than the price at our local grocery store and a box lasts a full month, so I have them on my Subscribe and Save delivery every month.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Parsons

customer_reviews.title: My food focused dog won't eat these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active Belgian Malinois. He burns so much energy that he eats 3 meals a day and remains slender. In addition to his dry and wet dog food, he is happy to consume almost anything out of the garden (sungold tomatoes, cucumbers, grapes). He's the kind of bottomless pit that made me stop saying to him, "you won't like this". But he has zero interest in Dentastix. I switched to using Plaque Off Apple & Bison flavor and he readily takes those to his "place".
customer_reviews.author: SnowKnitty

customer_reviews.title: Puppygirl loves these
customer_reviews.text: I have an 11 lb Chihuahua and she loves these. They don't last long, even though I buy the ones for large dogs. She chews them up in ten minutes, but she is an aggressive chewer. I have to say, I have bought these several times and even though she loves them, it is a little frustrating that half of the boxes I've bought have the treats stuck together and I have to break them apart. It's not a deal breaker, but I'd like to just grab one out of the box and hand it to her. Overall, a great treat.
customer_reviews.author: Mel P.

customer_reviews.title: 27 of them at once won't kill your dog. Thank goodness.
customer_reviews.text: Dog seemed to like them fine. Actually. Dog seemed to like them a lot as during his first unsupervised 2 hours at home, he jumped up on the counter, ripped open the bag, and ate TWENTY SEVEN of them. Four stars because when he's eaten them (supervised), he still manages to wolf them down without really requiring much "chewing", which I feel like sort of nullifies the purpose of the teeth cleaning aspect. Five stars because he didn't die after eating that many, which is more than some dog treats could claim. *Sigh*
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: They Work....they really work
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 dogs. These stix's have not only cleaned their teeth but two of them had poop breath. Teeth are white and poop breath is gone! What surprised me other than they really work is my dogs love them. They rip them out of my hand and run off to separate corners to enjoy their treats. Some times i give them flavored milk bones. They will take them and eat them ( well 4 dogs do, the 5th won't touch the milk bones), but you can tell they are not as excited as they are for these DENTASTIX Treats
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fogelson

customer_reviews.title: Potentially on sale at a better price
customer_reviews.text: We have been giving our mutt dentastix for 10 years or so now after switching from other greenie-type chews. She loves them but then again she would love a rock if she thought that it was human food. They don't seem to appreciably change her dental health and we have to get her teeth cleaned at least once a year.d 4 starts because she likes them and because it makes us feel good that we aren't neglecting her dental health. Knocked off a star because Costco runs a sale every couple of months that is a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Practical

customer_reviews.title: Great treats for medium to large dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these! They are a perfect size treat for my Boston Terriers to keep them occupied for a few minutes. The size is also appropriate for a larger dog; my putt bull enjoys the same treats. The treats do stick together though and often need to be broken apart (but with little effort). I also wish that this larger pack was able to be resealed. I’ve just resigned to putting them in a zipper pack for freshness. I’m unsure about their ability to freshen breath, but my dogs enjoy them and it doesn’t make their breath worse, so I’m going to keep using them!
customer_reviews.author: JFrank

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes them!
customer_reviews.text: My 40lb dog likes these (my last dog - 60lbs did too)! I do not love the smell, but it is not for me to love. It does not affect me any though - just when I hand it to her. I like them because they do not have any artificial flavors or colors. I just do not think that stuff is necessary. I only give her one once a week because for me, they are kind of expensive to give every day.
customer_reviews.author: forkfairy

customer_reviews.title: Not stinky and give a shiny smile
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these guys, she gets one in the morning. I've been home for the pandemic and stay up late but get up to walk the dog before returning to bed. This is when I give her the dentastix to keep her busy
customer_reviews.author: Captain Sheilan

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Our rescue loves these. Have no idea how healthy they are or if they really do keep his teeth clean? No dental problems yet. He looks forward to these daily and will let you know it is time if you don't hand one over at the regularly appointed hour. :o) We purchase these regularly and use one a day. As a side note, our 10-year-old dog gets the toy or small size and has lost interest lately. She liked them for a long time. I think they may be too hard for older dogs. Just a guess.
customer_reviews.author: RMD

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the original chicken flavor of PEDIGREE DENTASTIX Oral Care ...
customer_reviews.text: I got my PEDIGREE Dentastix Large Dog Treats. At first, my dog didn't care for it, but now she goes to the cabinet and begs for them. Contains one (1) 1.72-lb., 32-count pack of PEDIGREE DENTASTIX Original Large Treats for Dogs PEDIGREE DENTASTIX Triple Action works to clean teeth, freshen breath and is clinically proven to reduce plaque and tartar build up. Our dental sticks have an X-shape design and are specially designed for adult large breed dogs. Feed one PEDIGREE DENTASTIX Oral Care Treat every day for maximum benefits. Dogs love the original chicken flavor of PEDIGREE DENTASTIX Oral Care Treats. My dog would eat these all day long if she could.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Terri

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Best way to clean dog's teeth, and give them a treat whilst doing so. Saves a lot of money on teeth cleaning. My dog is 4 years old, and the vet says her teeth are great. No tarter, or problem with her gums. She weighs 20 lbs, and I give her half a Large size every single day. I buy the Large size, and then break them in half. It is cheaper this way. They are easy to break. Do not give more than the recommended dosage. I accidently did one day, and she got loose stools. . Won't do that again.
customer_reviews.author: Tashy

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: I have been giving my dog these treats for years. My dog expects them even and, wowee, does the rascal get stubborn if I don't give him one when he has earned it! Also, before I started giving him these treats, the vet would usually recommend that I have his teeth cleaned every other year. Now, the vet recommends cleanings only every 3 to 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: My dog adores these chews, no lie.
customer_reviews.text: My dog Marley had a lot of tartar when we brought him home from Woods Humane. After a few months of giving him these, his tartar is almost gone. He loves the flavor, when I open the ZIPLOC BAG. HELLO. THANK YOU. FOR THAT. He goes nuts. They do smell pretty good, and it is a good way to satisfy his constant craving for food, he is a certified chow hound. Without actually adding calories to his diet, and cleaning his teeth at the same time. Win win. AND i just got the most amazing deal on Amazon, which I never could have found here in town. Simply. amazing. Amazon. Thanks, Pedigree, and Amazing amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa in SLO

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these and after 6 years his teeth are very white! Breath smells good!
customer_reviews.text: My dog (26 lb male scottish terrier) loves these Dentastix and after 6 years his teeth are very white! I have been feeding these to him since he was a pupp. I give him one a day as a treat after his evening meal. My vet always compliments his teeth and thinks I am brushing them because he never has to do a cleaning. His breath always smells good also. The price on Amazon is fair in this size package.
customer_reviews.author: JamesT

customer_reviews.title: Our yellow lab enjoys these Dentastix. Only problem I ...
customer_reviews.text: Our yellow lab enjoys these Dentastix. Only problem I encountered was she somehow gets this treat wedged between her tooth in the roof of her mouth. She remained calm but I was a nervous wreck. The first time she just waited until her saliva softened it enough for it to fall onto her tongue, the second time I gently put my index finger in her mouth and pulled it down. After that I started breaking them in half so she wouldn't get them wedged in her mouth again. Not sure I will buy them again because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Delores White

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them.
customer_reviews.text: I've never used treats to train my dog. I trained with butt rubs. She'll do whatever I say in exchange for a buttrub. Now that we are older, we have to take extra care of our teeth. She doesn't care for greenies. So I tried these. Her teeth look cleaner and healthier. She also loves the flavor; she'll do anything I say for one of these treats!
customer_reviews.author: R.E.J.

customer_reviews.title: Lab won't eat Greenies, but loves Dentastix.
customer_reviews.text: My lab simply loves Dentastix, he is excited for his daily morning treat. These sticks also keep his teeth cleaner and I notice a slight lessening of tartar when he chews on these, so I always keep a supply at hand. There are many flavors available, but I think he prefers the original flavor the most. He somehow hates Greenies, and I've not had much success with most other dental chew treats that are so much more expensive, and supposed to be better quality, so I am glad he likes his Dentastix.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this ZERO stars I absolutely would !!!! So I gave my dogs pedigree dentastix yesterday and today. my bully was eating grass and being nasty to people yesterday, lethargic && wouldn’t touch the stick today. My Akita ate hers plus A small piece of his, Then an hour and a half / 2 hours go by and she starts crazy running so fast her back legs were giving out then all of a sudden she became lethargic and dazed and wobbly and was falling over so I videod with her vet and they said it was a small seizure. NOTHING had changed in their diet past two days besides these sticks. I definitely don’t recommend these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin amanda

customer_reviews.title: My Little Girl Loves Them....and the dog likes them too.
customer_reviews.text: Oh, that's an old pet-owner joke, don't you know. My little girl Pearl likes these treats better than anything, so I've given them to her since she was a pup. The vet comments on her teeth every time. I don't have to use that ridiculous finger toothbrush & beef-flavored toothpaste. I am a little concerned about ingredients that might be sourced from China, but what isn't from China these days? I've used these long-term, and never had a problem. Maybe the difference is that the chicken jerky treats that killed pets were ready-to-eat items made in China, while ingredients from China may not be as harmful after they go through processing in the USA to get the final product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Works great and dog loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes nuts over these! We give her one every night after dinner around 5:30 and if I forget, she starts pestering me and pacing back and forth to the kitchen, looking at the cabinet we keep them in. Her teeth have most certainly improved over the last two months from when she started eating them. She actually chews these up as well instead of swallowing them whole. She's a 50 pound, 3 year old boxer/pit mix (we think - she was from the humane society). Pet and pet parent approved!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Dental dentisticks
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes them very much. But I’m not so sure he wouldn’t like anything I give him to eat. I don’t think they do much to his teeth because they look the same. However, he had no tooth care until I got him at 5 years old. I would recommend them as worth a chance for your dog not to lose his teeth at old age.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. She gets really excited with just the sight of these and her breath has been smelling a lot better. I will say that the pack I got was not fresh. It felt really tough and I was worried my dog wouldn't like them, but She ate them, had a little trouble, but nothing too crazy. I did buy her the extra fresh ones and those came in a lot more soft and fresh. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Arslan

customer_reviews.title: Cleans his teeth
customer_reviews.text: 140 lb, 3 yr old male Great Pyrenees. His favorite treat and they really do help keep his teeth clean. He let's me brush his teeth, to a point, then clamps. It's over when he does that. Strong as a horse. I give him one in the morning after his walk, if he was good. Then one just before bed. He can pick up a full size soccer ball, size 5, in his mouth, so I get the size large Dentastix.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't like them
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought a bag of these, my dog was getting dentalife. I only bought these instead because Amazon was having a deal. Unfortunately, my dog got half way through eating her very first one and walked away from it. She doesn't like them and now I'm stuck with them. I'm going back to buying the cheaper, and apparently better tasting, Dentalife. The pros are the bag arrived in good shape and sticks smell good and fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: Nice size dog treat but had a strong chemical smell too. I upset my dog's stomach the first time they ate them but they adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal My Doggo loves them grandma too!
customer_reviews.text: Smells like bacon! My doggie loves these! Cleans his fangs too! He’s getting old & arthritis has come. Poor old guy. He loves these & he eats everything! Just like my 95 year old mom in law! Well she better not get at the dog chewier! Now that would be funny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle11

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: The use by date is over a year away, yet this one was not really fresh. Because I have used this product for years, I can tell from breaking them to feed my dogs if they are really fresh, ok but not fresh, definitely dried out. The timeliness and adequacy of delivery and packing is fine. I just can't quite justify internet purchasing of edible pet products, no fault of Dentastix or its seller. I inspect my own food before purchase, so would prefer to also inspect my pets' food when possible. Overall, and obviously, I like the product. My dogs like them. I can't testify to any oral care benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Chris

customer_reviews.title: My dog's teeth are so clean!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these since my dog was a puppy and she has never had plaque build up ever! The vet even says her teeth are so clean and I swear I have never actually brushed them! These works great and my dogs absolutely love them! I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Joe

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these! I have a 12 year old rottie and a 5 year old Boston Terrier. They each get 1 treat a day and they enjoy it. As soon as they hear me touch the bag they come running. It helps with keeping their teeth clean and their breath fresh. I've found that it does help with those two things. The sticks are packed nicely and paired up. So I just grab a pair and break them apart. My dogs are happy so we are too.
customer_reviews.author: Spoiled Rott'n

customer_reviews.title: Can't swallow whole like greenies
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these to Greenies because my dog does not swallow them whole like he does the Greenies. That totally defeats the teeth cleaning purposes! He's a 60 lb lab and has one a day (sometimes two by accident, but he doesn't get sick on these days). These don't comepletely prevent plaque build up. My dog loves them though! I also prefer the smell of these to the "Fresh" green flavor. To me the original smell is pleasant and minty, whereas the Fresh flavor smells strongly like cleaning products, and not minty.
customer_reviews.author: Katie HTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the lazy dog parent!
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely no interest in brushing my dog's teeth, so these are perfect. Our 85lb mastiff mix just went to the vet and got the all clear for her teeth so they're clearly working! We give her a stick once very few days (not daily). They're not her favorite treat I can tell, but she will still eat them up and her they VERY much help her breath! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these. My oldest dog that is 7 I ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. My oldest dog that is 7 I have been giving these to him since he was little. He has great teeth and the Dr was surprised he doesn't have much plaque. Apparently small dogs are prone to it and usually need dental work before age 7. He is no where needing anything like that. So I have 2 new puppies and I will give this to them daily as well.
customer_reviews.author: CRhine

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves Them. Cover art needs to change ASAP.
customer_reviews.text: I have several puppers, two of which are quite picky. And they all love these dentastix. Message to company: Please remove the cover art of a dog with human teeth. This is immensely disturbing. Have you learned nothing from the Paramount Sonic incident?
customer_reviews.author: Sir Sparky

customer_reviews.title: A Nightly Doggy Ritual Delivered To My Door. I'm Happy.
customer_reviews.text: We don't get to bed until the dogs hear "It's time to brush your teeth," so these are considered the household ticket for everyone to settle down and let go to bed. It's panic time if we run out, but now they will always be on hand because I can one-click order with other essentials and get some sleep. Please read the label on this and don't give your dogs more than what's recommended for their weight. If you follow directions, there is some benefit to the dog's teeth with no side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. MadsenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Dog-Approved and More Convenient on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my goldendoode, Watson. They appear to work well in keeping her teeth healthy and she likes having them as an evening snack. I give her one each night just before brushing my own teeth, so it's become a part of our routine. The Amazon price was much better than elsewhere, especially with Prime, so this made things a lot more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: RDDTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: My dog does not like these & I don’t like how they feel like rubber you pull a part from each other. He only eats half of a treat sometimes which is 100-% rare for my dog to do. I will not purchase these again, and since they come in a large box I feel sad for my dog having to endure these for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Pedigree makes for a happy home
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy getting these for my 2 little pups... it’s a ritual in our house that when they wake up in the morning with us... they run down the hallway to the door where they have their treats.... and then again at the end of the day! So we are happy cuz they are happy 😃...
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Fay

customer_reviews.title: One Healthy Treat!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely LOVES these dentastix. He is only 16 lbs. so I break them into two pieces and give him half each day. I read on a box a couple of years ago that they were for 30 lb. dogs and not to give them to smaller ones. So, I just give him half. He thinks they are the greatest treat ever. If I say anything about "brushing teeth", he goes wild, ready for his dentastik!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Williams

customer_reviews.title: a helpful and tasty treat for dog dental health.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a few years. Our dogs get one per day, and one dog is now 6, the other 4+, and their recent checkup, good teeth/gum report, with minor tartar buildup with younger dog, which was an abused rescue, so obviously not taken care of the 1st 3 yrs. of her life. She will get a dental cleaning to prevent any erosion, and even with other dog we raised from 4 wks. old, who was born in a dog shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Sandt

customer_reviews.title: but switched to Denistix because of the great reviews & much more affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I have an 11 year old, 75 pound Golden Retriever. I was giving him Greenies for awhile, but switched to Denistix because of the great reviews & much more affordable price! He Loves them! They smell a little like bacon, (I don't use mint). They help his breath, but don't do much for tartar, because he eats them so fast! I use gel for tartar. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Only helps future dental decay/plaque
customer_reviews.text: I asked my veterinarian about treats like these and Asked if they clean the teeth. His answer was that it can help prevent future dental decay but can’t help what’s already been done. He recommended brushing your dogs teeth if they have signs of decay but my dog and I both know we don’t want to do that so treats it is.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves these, I’ve given them to him since he was like three months and he has no plaque on his teeth at all. They’re good to make a bedtime routine with a puppy, give him one and put him in his crate and he knows it’s time to wind down. No idea how these work ( main ingredient is like chicken fat??) but I really don’t care they get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: LeGreta

customer_reviews.title: You fur baby will love
customer_reviews.text: Dominic LOVES his toothbrush, looks forward to it when we come in from wake up potty. My family has used pedigree for for generations, all dogs have lived long healthy lives. We use the food. Picture for attention
customer_reviews.author: Forshey

customer_reviews.title: both dogs through up off and on after a while
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my 2 GSD mixes complained to the chef, wanted there meal comped, and have me go through additional training, good grief Charlie Brown!
customer_reviews.author: dobie

customer_reviews.title: Best shine for your buck
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended, by name, by a vet when my dog was a pup. I've given him one every night his entire life. Combined with a dental cleaning every 5 years, at his last check up at 10 years, a different vet couldn't believe how old he was based on his teeth. She said whatever I was doing, keep doing it. As for people worried about their dogs choking on treats, they need to supervise them. You can't blame a treat for choking your dog, that's like blaming a coffee cup for attacking you.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSucks

customer_reviews.title: Great "Treat" that does what it says
customer_reviews.text: My dog thinks she is getting a special treat when I give her the daily Dentastix. I know this product works as it claims - will clean 80% of the plaque off your dogs teeth, because I could see the plaque on her teeth, especially the back teeth, and since I began giving her the Dentastix the plaque has absolutely been cleaned off almost completely. Believe me, I had worried about how to brush her teeth because of the size of her mouth! Now I don't have to worry about that... ::whew::
customer_reviews.author: Muse of Hell

customer_reviews.title: Great treat!
customer_reviews.text: We have always loved giving our puppy these. Goodness knows she needs the dental care. However, in her old age, she has grown tired of them. IWe’ll order the beef flavor next. Hopefully we’ll have another perfect breakfast snack for my elderly girl! My father-in-law’s sweet deaf Molly will get what we have left-she loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: When she's not eating butter, it's my dog's favorite treat!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 year old black lab and she LOVES these treats. She's really one to eat anything from sticks of butter (right out of the butter dish!) to loaves of bread (right off the counter!). While we work hard to bust her of these sneaky shenanigans - yes we even had to buy a locking kitchen trashcan - we know that the Dentastix are her favorite "allowable" treat, and she looks forward to getting her treat every afternoon. I have a subscription for this monthly, the price is definitely right, and it's great to not have to worry about picking them up at the store. I love the Amazon subscription options.
customer_reviews.author: ItsBecca

customer_reviews.title: Dentastix was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepherd loved the Dentastix! He needed some extra treats since he has been in the house more than usual. He gets 1/2 one as a treat when he doesn't chase the UPS Driver or the Amazon driver! LOL. Her already loves our mailman! I will definitely order more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Valenti

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely love these they did help with breath. I have two border Collies so it did not take them very long to eat these so I'm not really sure how well it did as far as cleaning teeth but it did help freshen breath.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: My dog love these sticks -- but they don't last much longer than a typical treat. I now break these apart and put them in a Kong to make them last.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the teeth clean
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the dogs teeth clean and breath is passable but I wonder if it makes her fart really bad. Been running us out of the room when she backdoor honks. Smells like a tipped over port-o-potty and made the baby throw up.
customer_reviews.author: G. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great treat and temporary distraction
customer_reviews.text: My foster greyhounds loves these. I've had two fosters who weren't big fans of rawhide, so I was looking for some type of edible "bone" that would keep them distracted a little longer than a simple treat would. Obviously these aren't super long lasting, but it's enough to get them to prance off happily and lay down for a while. They also fit in KONG bones!
customer_reviews.author: Ariz_Mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Clean teeth, stinky breath
customer_reviews.text: The dogs like them, their teeth seem to be pretty clean but they sure don't smell good or make the dogs breathsmell good:( I thought Fifi had gotten peed on, nope, it was her breath after she had her Dentastix. Someone did give us a pack of the mint (i think) flavor & that was much better, dog breath wise.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer savage

customer_reviews.title: We use these are treats AFTER we brush their teeth with a child's electric toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs get "Greenies" on Sundays and Dentastix on Wednesdays AFTER they all line up for their teeth brushing! We have four dogs and the younger ones have learned from the older ones. I use a children's electric toothbrush because it isn't so noisy and it doesn't take long at all. Not one of my dogs has had dental cleanings so far and the oldest is 6 years old. The veterinarian says their teeth are great and hasn't even recommend it on their annual exams. Taking care of your dogs dental health will help them live a longer, happier, healthier life.
customer_reviews.author: bascelflt

customer_reviews.title: My dogs are very old but are in great shape because I feed them only the best foods
customer_reviews.text: I give my dogs one of these every day because trying to brush their teeth every day is just too much trouble . Well.. .When I took them to the vet the last time , their teeth got rave reviews . My dogs are very old but are in great shape because I feed them only the best foods , give them daily walks , AND keep their teeth clean with Dentastix. Plus..they LOVE them!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Won't last long for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: My Doberman really likes these. She is still somewhat of a young dog (2 years old), so I cannot really comment if these have helped her teeth or not. I will say that she chews them very, very quickly. So if you are purchasing these thinking your large dog will gnaw on these for a while, you might be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: I buy too much on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Gone too fast!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these...a lot. The problem? One dentastix lasts about, oh, a minute, maybe a minute and a half. They are great for treats, he loves 'em, but he eats them so fast that I wonder how much good it can really do his teeth as far as cleaning goes - he doesn't have to chew too much. It seems like a bone would do more good in that aspect. So, in short...as a treat, they are great. As something to occupy your dog for more than a few minutes, or something that needs vigorous chewing, it fails.
customer_reviews.author: Hoshi

customer_reviews.title: Teeth cleeaning dog treats
customer_reviews.text: I like to use these because it occupies my dog for a while because he really loves treats. But it is also good to know that his teeth are getting somewhat cleaned thru their use. This was a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Schnauzer

customer_reviews.title: The product does a fine job keeping my Aussie's teeth clean.
customer_reviews.text: Last month I paid $8.99, this month the price went to $11.97. I was about to have it placed on auto delivery, but not now. Now I'm shopping. Time to eat crow. Went internet chopping. At this price they cost $0.38 each, Other brands, other stores best price $0.40+shipping some even over $1.00. I will reorder this from this dealer!
customer_reviews.author: James W. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't clean teeth, but dogs love the taste
customer_reviews.text: For dental hygiene, this was totally ineffective after using daily for a month on my 2 dogs (3 and 5 yrs old). As a treat, they loved it b/c it was more like a bone than a biscuit, and they would run off with it to hide and eat it. All the reviews mention how much their dogs love it, but nobody talks about whether it actually cleans their teeth. It does not.
customer_reviews.author: MD1983

customer_reviews.title: Great way to buy large treats for big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these, and they don't upset her sensitive stomach! I can't say they help with her teeth or horrific breath, BUT these are a nice-sized, affordable treat for a large breed dog. Most other treats large enough to last her more than one bite are expensive purchased alone or in pairs, but you can't beat this price for 32 treats!
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Dachshund stamp of approval
customer_reviews.text: Our dachshunds L♡VE these so much they inform us every night that it's time for their "toothbrush". I snap them in 4 pieces as soon as they arrive. Even though it's in a ziploc, they do dry out as they age. Doesn't seem to discourage our boys any, though.
customer_reviews.author: FamilyofFaith

customer_reviews.title: my husband and I have two adult great Pyrenees - they each get one of these every ...
customer_reviews.text: my husband and I have two adult great Pyrenees - they each get one of these every night before bed. they freak out when they hear the bag and pretty much are drooling to death while we make them patiently wait in a seated position until we say the command to eat... i'm not sure why they respond so well to these treats, but i'm very thankful because they're breathe has gone from did-you-just-eat-poo?-foul smelling to normal-dog breathe. these treats pretty much are the best ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Design

customer_reviews.title: Great as a treat; terrible for dental health
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these; she gets super excited any time I get one out. Unfortunately, they're terrible as dental chews. They smell awful (which is, of course, why my dog likes them so much) and definitely do not improve her breath. I've also noticed a significant INCREASE of plaque and tartar buildup since we've been feeding these to my dog. I know these aren't meant to replace regular brushing, but I'm pretty sure a good dental chew is not supposed to worsen the condition of my dog's teeth. We've resigned to just keep feeding the rest of the box as occasional treats.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good treats for your pack!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these things and they are spoiled to get these after their morning outside business. As the are good for their teeth I am less concerned with these as I would be with other treats. My big dog gets a large one and I break one in two for the Corgi. Have to always keep a supply handy or I get barked at. Who is the boss at my house....
customer_reviews.author: Kwebbster

customer_reviews.title: Dog Loves Them, Immediately Solved Bad Breath
customer_reviews.text: These treats tend to stick together in the bag but wasn't much of an issue. My dog enjoys them very much and he can be picky when it comes to food and treats. These immediately solved his bad breath and I could see a difference in the cleanliness of his teeth afterwards. They're a little high in calories so I give my dog half of one when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tetra

customer_reviews.title: Great Producr
customer_reviews.text: My senior lab loves these and they do help with her teeth and breath.
customer_reviews.author: bgbsn

customer_reviews.title: Good for a treat- not for your dogs breath
customer_reviews.text: Whew! These things stink! They sure wont be fixing your dogs breath! They are really chewy which is probably how they clean away gunk in dogs teeth. Whether they are effective teeth cleaners or not, my dogs really love them. They make a great treat. They are usually eaten up pretty quickly so dont expect them to last longer than 30 mins!! Thankfully this pack comes with a lot of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anything to help preserve his dental health
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a few teeth pulled recently so I'm on a mission to maintain good dental hygienes for him. He loves these dental chews. I hope it works in helping keep his teeth and gum healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Letran, Author of the Award-Winning Words of Wisdom for Teens book series

customer_reviews.title: Rock hard for some reason
customer_reviews.text: They are rock hard. My dogs cant barley chew them. Ive gotten these from the store before and they were not this hard. I cant even pull them apart. I have to use a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your dog likes them
customer_reviews.text: I have a Great Dane and she is a picky eater. However her breathe deals so I bought these dental sticks. I can't give it a great rating since she ate them for about 2 weeks and her breath still smells awful. Now she refuses to eat them at all. However my mother has a pitbull mix and says the dog loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna B

customer_reviews.title: Plaible, chewy but feel waxy and unnatural.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of different dental treats available these days. My dog is 16 years old and missing a few teeth so something a little pliable but still chewy is good for her to help scrape off tartar. If the sticks are too hard, she cannot penetrate it when biting and possible lose another tooth. These are pretty good for that purpose. The dental sticks do feel waxy and a bit unnatural like something synthetic was added.
customer_reviews.author: Xzone9 Productions

customer_reviews.title: dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dogs, because I've been noticing bad breath. I didn't realize until I got them in that they were only for dogs over 30lbs. Luckily, one of my dogs weighs right at 30lbs. He loves these treats, and so far his breath smells a lot fresher! Hopefully these will help prevent dental disease
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Her teeth are white and she loves them!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs teeth are white. No tarter on her gun line. No bad breath. She's 5 years old and her breath had gotten pretty bad. I'd also like to point out that she absolutely loves these and stands by the cabinet every morning waiting for it. The ingredients don't look like the greatest, but she only gets 1 or 2 a day and they work! I would say it took a month before her teeth were really really white.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy H

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes one is not enough and he paws the book I'm reading out of my hands to tell me his teeth are really dirty and he needs
customer_reviews.text: When we get in to bed every night my dog waits--not very patiently--for me to get the jar of "toothbrushes" for him. Sometimes one is not enough and he paws the book I'm reading out of my hands to tell me his teeth are really dirty and he needs another toothbrush! It's our nightly ritual and when I run out he is not satisfied with my explanation that they are "gone-gone." Even when I show him my hands like a card dealer he is convinced I have one hidden in the bed somewhere. He loves these things!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Clark

customer_reviews.title: My Great Pyrenees is super picky but needed something to help ...
customer_reviews.text: My Great Pyrenees is super picky but needed something to help with his teeth since he won't allow brushing and hates every treat we give him. But he LOVES these. Finding large enough treats for him is usually difficult and expensive. He still eats these rather quickly so we just give him one in the morning and one at night but it has slowly improved his teeth and he feels special without breaking our wallets.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Tarter be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Dentastix for years with my 3 dogs and they have keep tarter off their teeth. They absolutely love the taste and they expect their Dentastix every morning at 6PM after they have gone out. If your dog is on a restrictive diet, make sure to let your vet know so she can adjust food portion size accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Marge0808

customer_reviews.title: Stinky but... ok?
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t like the smell of these (reminds me of plastic packaging!) the dogs don’t seem to mind. I prefer the mint flavor and I’ll stick with those in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Goofyblue

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves these!
customer_reviews.text: I love that my dog views these as nothing more than a great daily treat. She LOVES them. And I love that they may add years on her life and keep her healthy. Not to mention, they're the most affordable teeth-chews I've seen and from a trusted brand. Who could ask for more? Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ExtremeAmazonAddictTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Product stale.
customer_reviews.text: Very stale and color darker than the fresh ones I usually get from my local grocery store. They are very hard compared to the ones from my local grocery store. My senior dog used to love these but these I got from Amazon are too hard and stale for him to chew. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Following Christ

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and Clean
customer_reviews.text: These work really well, the dog loves them and it keeps him out of the vets office for dangerous teeth cleaning, helps with bad breathe because it knocks off a good amount of tartar.
customer_reviews.author: Bob d.

customer_reviews.title: Great treat!
customer_reviews.text: My four dogs love these. I buy both the small size and large... everybody it’s delighted for the tasty treat. I still brush their teeth, so not sure it is completely sufficient for oral care.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Lynn Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Grossly outdated item
customer_reviews.text: Just noticed a best by date of 03/22/16 on a package of Dentastix. This is the 2nd package where I've had trouble separating the pieces. 1 package was purchased Sept 14, 2019, the 2nd was purchased Nov 27, 2019. That's two and a half years. Much too long for a "perishable ?" item.
customer_reviews.author: SargeTom

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. Works well to keep his teeth clean. He likes the taste of them and can't wait to get one everyday. The price is much better than in the store.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: seems to work
customer_reviews.text: my dogs luv these things, dnt know what they put in them for a dog to go nuts, every night about 7-7:30pm my dogs run in circles in front of the cabinet where i keep these. it took a couple days to figure why they were doing this but then i realized it was these denta sticks. they seem to keep there teeth clean
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: buck was a happy boy
customer_reviews.text: this is bucks favorite treat. Buck is our 80lb German Shepherd who looks forward to his dentastix each and every morning. thanks to Amazon for such great delivery time he can be assured they will be available each and everyday
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: and break them all into singles at once so they can easily be grabbed for a treat
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these!!! They do come with all of them stuck 2 or 4 together, it seems that's how they're made, and they can be a little difficult to break apart so I typically open the bag, and break them all into singles at once so they can easily be grabbed for a treat. Only takes a couple minutes but does hurt my fingers sometimes to get them apart... It's worth the 5 minutes, because my dog absolutely loves them.
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: He gets one a day, and i tell him he must drink after he eats his treat. (I think i read somewhere that dogs should drink after consuming these) They do help with his teeth (although im not sure how much) and he loves to chew on things. Win. Win.
customer_reviews.author: S.E.B

product_meta.title: Pedigree DENTASTIX Treats for Large Dogs, 30+ lbs. Multiple Flavors
product_meta.description:
Flavor Name:Chicken| Size:32 TreatsTreat your dog to Pedigree Dentastix Large Dental Dog Treats, the perfect snack that adds a delicious original Chicken flavored boost to your dog’s oral care routine. Formulated for large dogs, these chewy dog treats fight bad dog breath while delivering a delicious taste for your best friend. Give your dog all the teeth-cleaning action of Pedigree Dentastix Treats with flavors they’ll love.

AMAZON.COM
Dog Treats to Support a Clean Mouth!
feature_bullets: Contains (1) 1.72 pounds 32-count pack of Pedigree Dentastix Original Large Treats for Dogs
Pedigree Dentastix Triple Action acts as a dog breath freshener that works to clean teeth and freshen breath, and has a clinically proven texture that reduces plaque and tartar buildup
Our dental dog treats have an X-shape design and are specially designed dog treats for large dogs that clean teeth and freshen breath
These tasty dog breath treats are bite-size treats and are perfect for dogs 30 pounds or more
Pedigree Dentastix Dental Chews feature a tasty original chicken flavor your dog will truly enjoy
Feed (1) Pedigree Dentastix Oral Care Treat every day for maximum benefits
Helps clean down to the gumline to promote healthy teeth and gums

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
